alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 2:19PM MDT until June 03 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following county, Phillips. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 216 PM MDT, Officials from the CMR National Wildlife Refuge reported that Rock Creek Road is closed due to a wash out from recent heavy rainfall and associated flooding. - 11 Miles west of Highway 191 on Rock Creek Road is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Phillips County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
